intro: Messerschmidia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. It is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early summer.
